summary.long: 2 Samuel is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: After the death of Saul, when David was returned from the slaughter of the Amalekites, and had been two days in Ziklag,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, a man came the third day out of the host from Saul with his clothes rent, and earth upon his head: and when he came to David, he fell to the earth, and did obeisance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said unto him, Whence comest thou? And he said unto him, Out of the host of Israel I am escaped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David said unto him, What is done? I pray thee, tell me. Then he said, that the people is fled from the battle, and many of the people are overthrown, and dead, and also Saul and Jonathan his son are dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David said unto the young man that told it him, How knowest thou that Saul and Jonathan his son be dead?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the young man that told him, answered, As I came to mount Gilboa, behold, Saul leaned upon his spear, and lo, the chariots and horsemen followed hard after him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he looked back, he saw me, and called me. And I answered, Here am I.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto me, Who art thou? And I answered him, I am an Amalekite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said he unto me, I pray thee,come upon me, and slay me: for anguish is come upon me, because my life is yet whole in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I came upon him, and slew him, and because I was sure that he could not live, after that he had fallen, I took the crown that was upon his head, and the bracelet that was on his arm, and brought them hither unto my lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David took hold on his clothes, and rent them, and likewise all the men that were with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they mourned and wept, and fasted until even, for Saul and for Jonathan his son, and for the people of the Lord, and for the house of Israel, because they were slain with the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward David said unto the young man that told it him, Whence art thou? And he answered, I am the son of a stranger an Amalekite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David said unto him, How wast thou not afraid, to put forth thine hand to destroy the Anointed of the Lord?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David called one of his young men, and said, Go near, and fall upon him. And he smote him that he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said David unto him, Thy blood be upon thine own head: for thine own mouth hath testified against thee, saying, I have slain the Lord’s Anointed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David mourned with this lamentation over Saul, and over Jonathan his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Also he bade them teach the children of Judah to shoot, as it is written in the book of Jasher.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O noble Israel, he is slain upon thy high places: how are the mighty overthrown!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell it not in Gath, nor publish it in the streets of Ashkelon, lest the daughters of the Philistines rejoice, lest the daughters of the uncircumcised triumph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye mountains of Gilboa, upon you be neither dew nor rain, nor be there fields of offerings: for there the shield of the mighty is cast down, the shield of Saul, as though he had not been anointed with oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The bow of Jonathan never turned back, neither did the sword of Saul return empty from the blood of the slain, and from the fat of the mighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saul and Jonathan were lovely and pleasant in their lives, and in their deaths they were not divided: they were swifter than eagles, they were stronger than lions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye daughters of Israel, weep for Saul, which clothed you in scarlet, with pleasures, and hanged ornaments of gold upon your apparel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How were the mighty slain in the midst of the battle! O Jonathan, thou wast slain in thine high places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe is me for thee, my brother Jonathan: very kind hast thou been unto me: thy love to me was wonderful, passing the love of women: how are the mighty overthrown, and the weapons of war destroyed!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, David asked counsel of the Lord, saying, Shall I go up into any of the cities of Judah? And the Lord said unto him, Go up. And David said, Whither shall I go? He then answered, Unto Hebron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David went up thither, and his two wives also, Ahinoam the Jezreelitess, and Abigail Nabal’s wife the Carmelite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David brought up the men that were with him, every man with his household, and they dwelt in the cities of Hebron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the men of Judah came, and there they anointed David King over the house of Judah. And they told David, saying, that the men of Jabesh Gilead buried Saul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David sent messengers unto the men of Jabesh Gilead, and said unto them, Blessed are ye of the Lord, that ye have showed such kindness unto your lord Saul, that you have buried him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore now the Lord show mercy and truth unto you: and I will recompense you this benefit, because ye have done this thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore now let your hands be strong, and be you valiant: albeit your master Saul be dead, yet nevertheless the house of Judah hath anointed me King over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Abner the son of Ner that was captain of Saul’s host, took Ishbosheth the son of Saul, and brought him to Mahanaim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And made him King over Gilead, and over the Ashurites, and over Jezreel, and over Ephraim, and over Benjamin, and over all Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ishbosheth Saul’s son was forty years old when he began to reign over Israel, and reigned two years: but the house of Judah followed David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (And the time which David reigned in Hebron over the house of Judah, was seven years and six months.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abner the son of Ner, and the servants of Ishbosheth the son of Saul went out of Mahanaim to Gibeon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joab the son of Zeruiah, and the servants of David went out and met one another by the pool of Gibeon: and they sat down, the one on the one side of the pool, and the other on the other side of the pool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abner said to Joab, Let the young men now arise, and play before us. And Joab said, Let them arise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then there arose and went over twelve of Benjamin by number, which pertained to Ishbosheth the son of Saul, and twelve of the servants of David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And every one caught his fellow by the head, and thrust his sword in his fellow’s side, so they fell down together: wherefore the place was called Helkath Hazzurim, which is in Gibeon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the battle was exceedingly sore that same day: for Abner and the men of Israel fell before the servants of David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were three sons of Zeruiah there, Joab, and Abishai, and Asahel. And Asahel was as light on foot as a wild roe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Asahel followed after Abner, and in going he turned neither to the right hand nor to the left from Abner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abner looked behind him, and said, Art thou Asahel? And he answered, Yea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abner said, Turn thee either to the right hand or to the left, and take one of the young men, and take thee his weapons: and Asahel would not depart from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abner said to Asahel, Depart from me: wherefore should I smite thee to the ground? how then should I be able to hold up my face to Joab thy brother?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he would not depart, Abner with the hinder end of the spear smote him under the fifth rib, that the spear came out behind him: and he fell down there, and died in his place. And as many as came to the place where Asahel fell down, and died, stood still.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joab also and Abishai pursued after Abner: and the sun went down when they were come to the hill Ammah, that lieth before Giah by the way of the wilderness of Gibeon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the children of Benjamin gathered themselves together after Abner, and were on an heap, and stood on the top of an hill.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abner called to Joab, and said, Shall the sword devour forever? knowest thou not, that it will be bitterness in the latter end? how long then shall it be, or thou bid the people return from following their brethren?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joab said, As God liveth, if thou hadst not spoken, surely even in the morning the people had departed every one back from his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joab blew a trumpet, and all the people stood still, and pursued after Israel no more, neither fought they anymore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abner and his men walked all that night through the plain, and went over Jordan, and past through all Bithron till they came to Mahanaim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joab also returned back from Abner: and when he had gathered all the people together, there lacked of David’s servants nineteen men, and Asahel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the servants of David had smitten of Benjamin, and of Abner’s men, so that three hundred and threescore men died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they took up Asahel, and buried him in the sepulcher of his father, which was in Bethlehem: and Joab and his men went all night, and when they came to Hebron, the day arose.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was then long war between the house of Saul and the house of David: but David waxed stronger, and the house of Saul waxed weaker.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And unto David were children born in Hebron: and his eldest son was Amnon of Ahinoam the Jezreelitess,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his second, was Chileab of Abigail the wife of Nabal the Carmelite: and the third, Absalom the son of Maacah the daughter of Talmai the king of Geshur,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the fourth, Adonijah the son of Haggith: and the fifth, Shephatiah the son of Abital:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sixth, Ithream by Eglah David’s wife: these were born to David in Hebron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while there was war between the house of Saul and the house of David, Abner made all his power for the house of Saul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Saul had a concubine named Rizpah, the daughter of Aiah. And Ishbosheth said to Abner, Wherefore hast thou gone in to my father’s concubine?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then was Abner very wroth for the words of Ishbosheth, and said, Am I a dog’s head, which against Judah do show mercy this day unto the house of Saul thy father, to his brethren, and to his neighbors, and have not delivered thee into the hand of David, that thou chargest me this day with a fault concerning this woman?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So do God to Abner, and more also, except, as the Lord hath sworn to David, even so I do to him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To remove the kingdom from the house of Saul, that the throne of David may be established over Israel, and over Judah, even from Dan to Beersheba.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he durst no more answer to Abner: for he feared him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abner sent messengers to David on his behalf, saying, Whose is the land? who should also say, Make covenant with me, and behold, mine hand shall be with thee, to bring all Israel unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who said, Well, I will make a covenant with thee: but one thing I require of thee, that is, that thou see not my face, except thou bring Michal Saul’s daughter when thou comest to see me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David sent messengers to Ishbosheth Saul’s son, saying, Deliver me my wife Michal, which I married for an hundred foreskins of the Philistines.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Ishbosheth sent, and took her from her husband Paltiel the son of Laish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And her husband went with her, and came weeping behind her, unto Bahurim: then said Abner unto him, Go, and return. So he returned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abner had communication with the Elders of Israel, saying, Ye fought for David in times past, that he might be your King.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now then do it: for the Lord hath spoken of David, saying, By the hand of my servant David I will save my people Israel out of the hands of the Philistines, and out of the hands of all their enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also Abner spake to Benjamin, and afterward Abner went to speak with David in Hebron, concerning all that Israel was content with, and the whole house of Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Abner came to David to Hebron, having twenty men with him, and David made a feast unto Abner, and to the men that were with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abner said unto David, I will rise up, and go gather all Israel unto my lord the King, that they may make a covenant with thee, and that thou mayest reign over all that thine heart desireth. Then David let Abner depart, who went in peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, the servants of David and Joab came from the camp, and brought a great prey with them (but Abner was not with David in Hebron: for he had sent him away, and he departed in peace.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Joab, and all the host that was with him were come, men told Joab, saying, Abner the son of Ner came to the King, and he hath sent him away, and he is gone in peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joab came to the King, and said, What hast thou done? behold, Abner came unto thee, why hast thou sent him away, and he is departed?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou knowest Abner the son of Ner: for he came to deceive thee, and to know thy outgoing and ingoing, and to know all that thou doest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Joab was gone out from David, he sent messengers after Abner, which brought him again from the well of Sirah unknowing to David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Abner was come again to Hebron, Joab took him aside in the gate to speak with him peaceably, and smote him under the fifth rib, that he died, for the blood of Asahel his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when afterward it came to David’s ear, he said, I and my Kingdom are guiltless before the Lord forever, concerning the blood of Abner the son of Ner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the blood fall on the head of Joab, and on all his father’s house, that the house of Joab be never without some that have running issues, or leper, or that leaneth on a staff, or that doeth fall on the sword, or that lacketh bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (So Joab and Abishai his brother slew Abner, because he had slain their brother Asahel at Gibeon in battle.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David said to Joab, and to all the people that were with him, Rent your clothes, and put on sackcloth, and mourn before Abner: and King David himself followed the bier.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had buried Abner in Hebron, the King lift up his voice, and wept beside the sepulcher of Abner, and all the people wept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the King lamented over Abner, and said, Died Abner as a fool dieth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thine hands were not bound, nor thy feet tied in fetters of brass: but as a man falleth before wicked men, so didst thou fall. And all the people wept again for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward all the people came to cause David eat meat while it was yet day, but David swore, saying, So do God to me and more also, if I taste bread, or ought else till the sun be down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the people knew it, and it pleased them: as whatsoever the King did, pleased all the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all the people and all Israel understood that day, how that it was not the King’s deed that Abner the son of Ner was slain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the King said unto his servants, Know ye not, that there is a prince and a great man fallen this day in Israel?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I am this day weak and newly anointed King: and these men the sons of Zeruiah be too hard for me: the Lord reward the doer of evil according to his wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Saul’s son heard that Abner was dead in Hebron, then his hands were feeble, and all Israel was afraid,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Saul’s son had two men that were captains of bands: the one called Baanah, and the other called Rechab, the sons of Rimmon a Beerothite of the children of Benjamin: (for Beeroth was reckoned to Benjamin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because the Beerothites fled to Gittaim, and sojourned there, unto this day.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jonathan Saul’s son had a son that was lame on his feet: he was five years old when the tidings came of Saul and Jonathan out of Israel: then his nurse took him, and fled away. And as she made haste to flee, the child fell, and began to halt, and his name was Mephibosheth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Rimmon the Beerothite, Rechab and Baanah went and came in the heat of the day to the house of Ishbosheth (who slept on a bed at noon.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, Rechab and Baanah his brother came into the midst of the house, as they would have wheat, and they smote him under the fifth rib, and fled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when they came into the house, he slept on his bed in his bed chamber, and they smote him, and slew him, and beheaded him, and took his head, and got them away through the plain all the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they brought the head of Ishbosheth unto David to Hebron, and said to the king, Behold the head of Ishbosheth Saul’s son thine enemy, who sought after thy life: and the Lord hath avenged my Lord the King this day of Saul, and of his seed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David answered Rechab and Baanah his brother, the sons of Rimmon the Beerothite, and said unto them, As the Lord liveth, who hath delivered my soul out of all adversity,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When one told me, and said that Saul was dead, (thinking to have brought good tidings) I took him and slew him in Ziklag, who thought that I would have given him a reward for his tidings:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How much more when wicked men have slain a righteous person in his own house, and upon his bed? shall I not now therefore require his blood at your hand, and take you from the earth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David commanded his young men, and they slew them, and cut off their hands and their feet, and hanged them up over the pool in Hebron: but they took the head of Ishbosheth, and buried it in the sepulcher of Abner in Hebron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came all the tribes of Israel to David unto Hebron, and said thus, Behold, we are thy bones and thy flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in time past when Saul was our King, thou leddest Israel in and out: and the Lord hath said to thee, Thou shalt feed my people Israel, and thou shalt be a captain over Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all the Elders of Israel came to the king to Hebron: and King David made a covenant with them in Hebron before the Lord, and they anointed David King over Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David was thirty years old when he began to reign: and he reigned forty years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In Hebron he reigned over Judah seven years, and six months: and in Jerusalem he reigned thirty and three years over all Israel and Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The King also and his men went to Jerusalem unto the Jebusites, the inhabitants of the land: who spake unto David, saying, Except thou take away the blind and the lame, thou shalt not come in hither: thinking that David could not come thither:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But David took the fort of Zion: this is the city of David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now David had said the same day, Whosoever smiteth the Jebusites, and getteth up to the gutters and smiteth the lame and blind, which David’s soul hateth, I will prefer him: therefore they said, The blind and the lame shall not come into that house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David dwelt in that fort, and called it the city of David, and David built round about it, from Millo, and inward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David prospered and grew: for the Lord God of hosts was with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hiram also king of Tyre sent messengers to David, and cedar trees, and carpenters, and masons for walls: and they built David an house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David knew that the Lord had established him King over Israel, and that he had exalted his kingdom for his people Israel’s sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David took him more concubines and wives out of Jerusalem, after he was come from Hebron, and more sons and daughters were born to David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these be the names of the sons, that were born unto him in Jerusalem, Shammua, and Shobab, and Nathan, and Solomon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Ibhar, and Elishua, and Nepheg, and Japhia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Elishama, and Eliada, and Eliphelet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the Philistines heard that they had anointed David king over Israel, all the Philistines came up to seek David: and when David heard, he went down to a fort.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Philistines came, and spread themselves in the valley of Rephaim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David asked counsel of the Lord, saying, Shall I go up to the Philistines? wilt thou deliver them into mine hands? And the Lord answered David, Go up: for I will doubtless deliver the Philistines into thine hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David came to Baal Perazim, and smote them there, and said, The Lord hath divided mine enemies asunder before me, as waters be divided asunder: therefore he called the name of that place, Baal Perazim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there they left their images, and David and his men burnt them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again the Philistines came up, and spread themselves in the valley of Rephaim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when David asked counsel of the Lord, he answered, Thou shalt not go up, but turn about behind them, and come upon them over against the mulberry trees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when thou hearest the noise of one going in the tops of the mulberry trees, then remove: for then shall the Lord go out before thee to smite the host of the Philistines.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David did so as the Lord had commanded him, and smote the Philistines from Geba, until thou come to Gezer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again David gathered together all the chosen men of Israel, even thirty thousand
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David arose, and went with all the people that were with him from Baale of Judah, to bring up from thence the Ark of God, whose Name is called by the Name of the Lord of hosts, that dwelleth upon it between the Cherubims.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they put the Ark of God upon a new cart, and brought it out of the house of Abinadab, that was in Gibeah. And Uzzah and Ahio the sons of Abinadab did drive the new cart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they brought the Ark of God out of the house of Abinadab, that was at Gibeah, Ahio went before the Ark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David and all the house of Israel played before the Lord on all instruments made of fir, and on harps, and on Psalteries, and on timbrels, and on cornets, and on cymbals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they came to Nachon’s threshing floor, Uzzah put his hand to the Ark of God, and held it: for the oxen did shake it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord was very wroth with Uzzah, and God smote him in the same place for his fault, and there he died by the Ark of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David was displeased because the Lord had smitten Uzzah: and he called the name of the place Perez Uzzah until this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore David that day feared the Lord, and said, How shall the Ark of the Lord come to me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David would not bring the Ark of the Lord unto him into the city of David, but David carried it into the house of Obed-Edom a Gittite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Ark of the Lord continued in the house of Obed-Edom the Gittite, three months, and the Lord blessed Obed-Edom, and all his household.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one told King David, saying, The Lord hath blessed the house of Obed-Edom, and all that he hath, because of the Ark of God: therefore David went and brought the Ark of God from the house of Obed-Edom, into the city of David with gladness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they that bare the Ark of the Lord had gone six paces, he offered an ox, and a fat beast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David danced before the Lord with all his might, and was girded with a linen Ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David and all the house of Israel brought the Ark of the Lord with shouting, and sound of trumpet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as the Ark of the Lord came into the city of David, Michal Saul’s daughter looked through a window, and saw King David leap, and dance before the Lord, and she despised him in her heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had brought in the Ark of the Lord, they set it in his place, in the midst of the Tabernacle that David had pitched for it: then David offered burnt offerings, and peace offerings before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as soon as David had made an end of offering burnt offerings and peace offerings, he blessed the people in the Name of the Lord of hosts,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And gave among all the people, even among the whole multitude of Israel, as well to the women as men, to every one a cake of bread, and a piece of flesh, and a bottle of wine: so all the people departed every one to his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David returned to bless his house, and Michal the daughter of Saul came out to meet David, and said, O how glorious was the King of Israel this day, which was uncovered today in the eyes of the maidens of his servants, as a fool uncovereth himself!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said unto Michal, It was before the Lord, which chose me rather than thy father, and all his house, and commanded me to be ruler over the people of the Lord, even over Israel: and therefore will I play before the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And will yet be more vile than thus, and will be low in mine own sight, and of the very same maidservants, which thou hast spoken of, shall I be had in honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore Michal the daughter of Saul had no child unto the day of her death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward when the King sat in his house, and the Lord had given him rest round about from all his enemies,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The King said unto Nathan the Prophet, Behold, now I dwell in an house of cedar trees, and the Ark of God remaineth within the curtains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Nathan said unto the king, Go, and do all that is in thine heart: for the Lord is with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the same night the word of the Lord came unto Nathan, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go and tell my servant David, Thus saith the Lord, Shalt thou build me an house for my dwelling?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have dwelt in no house since the time that I brought the children of Israel out of Egypt unto this day, but have walked in a tent and Tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In all the places wherein I have walked with all the children of Israel, spake I one word with any of the tribes of Israel when I commanded the Judges to feed my people Israel? or said I, Why build ye not me an house of cedar trees?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore so say unto my servant David, Thus saith the Lord of hosts, I took thee from the sheepcote following the sheep, that thou mightest be ruler over my people, over Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I was with thee wheresoever thou hast walked, and have destroyed all thine enemies out of thy sight, and have made thee a great name, like unto the name of the great men that are in the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Also I will appoint a place for my people Israel, and will plant it, that they may dwell in a place of their own, and move no more, neither shall wicked people trouble them anymore as beforetime,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And since the time that I set Judges over my people of Israel) and I will give thee rest from all thine enemies: also the Lord telleth thee, that he will make thee an house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when thy days be fulfilled, thou shalt sleep with thy fathers, and I will set up thy seed after thee, which shall proceed out of thy body, and will establish his kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall build an house for my Name, and I will establish the throne of his kingdom forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will be his father, and he shall be my son: and if he sin, I will chasten him with the rod of men, and with the plagues of the children of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But my mercy shall not depart away from him, as I took it from Saul whom I have put away before thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thine house shall be established and thy kingdom forever before thee, even thy throne shall be established forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to all these words, and according to all this vision, Nathan spake thus unto David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then King David went in, and sat before the Lord, and said, Who am I, O Lord God, and what is mine house, that thou hast brought me hitherto?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this was yet a small thing in thy sight, O Lord God, therefore thou hast spoken also of thy servant’s house for a great while: but doth this appertain to man, O Lord God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And what can David say more unto thee? for thou, Lord God, knowest thy servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thy word’s sake, and according to thine own heart hast thou done all these great things, to make them known unto thy servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore thou art great, O Lord God: for there is none like thee, neither is there any God besides thee, according to all that we have heard with our ears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And what one people in the earth is like thy people, like Israel? whose God went and redeemed them to himself, that they might be his people, and that he might make him a name, and do for you great things, and terrible for thy land, O Lord, even for thy people, whom thou redeemedst to thee out of Egypt, from the nations, and their gods?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thou hast ordained to thyself thy people Israel to be thy people forever: and thou Lord art become their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, O Lord God, confirm forever the word that thou hast spoken concerning thy servant and his house, and do as thou hast said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And let thy Name be magnified forever by them that shall say, The Lord of hosts is the God over Israel, and let the house of thy servant David be established before thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thou, O Lord of hosts, God of Israel, hast revealed unto thy servant, saying, I will build thee an house: therefore hath thy servant been bold to pray this prayer unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore now, O Lord God, (for thou art God, and thy words be true, and thou hast told this goodness unto thy servant.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore now let it please thee to bless the house of thy servant, that it may continue forever before thee: for thou, O Lord God, hast spoken it: and let the house of thy servant be blessed forever with thy blessing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this now, David smote the Philistines and subdued them, and David took the bridle of bondage out of the hand of the Philistines.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he smote Moab, and measured them with a cord, and cast them down to the ground: he measured them with two cords to put them to death, and with one full cord to keep them alive: so became the Moabites David’s servants, and brought gifts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David smote also Hadadezer the son of Rehob king of Zobah, as he went to recover his border at the river Euphrates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David took of them a thousand and seven hundred horsemen, and twenty thousand footmen, and David destroyed all the chariots, but he reserved an hundred chariots of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came the Aramites of Dammesek to succor Hadadezer king of Zobah, but David slew of the Aramites two and twenty thousand men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David put a garrison in Aram of Dammesek: and the Aramites became servants to David, and brought gifts. And the Lord saved David wheresoever he went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David took the shields of gold that belonged to the servants of Hadadezer, and brought them to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And out of Betah, and Berothai (cities of Hadadezer) king David brought exceedingly much brass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Toi king of Hamath heard how David had smitten all the host of Hadadezer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore Toi sent Joram his son unto king David, to salute him, and to rejoice with him, because he had fought against Hadadezer, and beaten him (for Hadadezer had war with Toi) who brought with him vessels of silver, and vessels of gold, and vessels of brass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And king David dedicated them unto the Lord with the silver and gold that he had dedicated of all the nations, which he had subdued:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Aram, and of Moab, and of the children of Ammon, and of the Philistines, and of Amalek, and of the spoil of Hadadezer the son of Rehob king of Zobah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David got a name after that he returned, and had slain of the Aramites in the valley of salt eighteen thousand men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he put a garrison in Edom: throughout all Edom put he soldiers, and all they of Edom became David’s servants: and the Lord kept David whithersoever he went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus David reigned over all Israel, and executed judgment and justice unto all his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joab the son of Zeruiah was over the host, and Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud was Recorder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Zadok the son of Ahitub, and Ahimelech the son of Abiathar were the Priests, and Seraiah the Scribe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Benaiah the son of Jehoiada and the Cherethites and the Pelethites, and David’s sons were chief rulers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David said, Is there yet any man left of the house of Saul, that I may show him mercy for Jonathan’s sake?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was of the household of Saul a servant whose name was Ziba, and when they had called him unto David, the king said unto him, Art thou Ziba? And he said, I thy servant am he.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the King said, Remaineth there yet none of the house of Saul, on whom I may show the mercy of God? Ziba then answered the King, Jonathan hath yet a son lame of his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the King said unto him, Where is he? And Ziba said unto the king, Behold, he is in the house of Machir the son of Ammiel of Lo Debar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then king David sent, and took him out of the house of Machir the son of Ammiel of Lo Debar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Mephibosheth the son of Jonathan the son of Saul was come unto David, he fell on his face, and did reverence. And David said, Mephibosheth? And he answered, Behold thy servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said unto him, Fear not: for I will surely show thee kindness for Jonathan thy father’s sake, and will restore thee all the fields of Saul thy father, and thou shalt eat bread at my table continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he bowed himself, and said, What is thy servant, that thou shouldest look upon such a dead dog as I am?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king called Ziba Saul’s servant, and said unto him, I have given unto thy master’s son all that pertained to Saul and to all his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou therefore and thy sons and thy servants shall till the land for him, and bring in that thy master’s son may have food to eat. And Mephibosheth thy master’s son shall eat bread always at my table (now Ziba had fifteen sons, and twenty servants.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Ziba unto the king, According to all that my lord the king hath commanded his servant, so shall thy servant do, that Mephibosheth may eat at my table, as one of the king’s sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mephibosheth also had a young son named Micha, and all that dwelled in the house of Ziba, were servants unto Mephibosheth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Mephibosheth dwelt in Jerusalem: for he did eat continually at the king’s table, and was lame on both his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, the King of the children of Ammon died, and Hanun his son reigned in his stead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said David, I will show kindness unto Hanun the son of Nahash, as his father showed kindness unto me. And David sent his servants to comfort him for his father. So David’s servants came into the land of the children of Ammon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the princes of the children of Ammon said unto Hanun their lord, Thinkest thou that David doth honor thy father, that he hath sent comforters to thee? hath not David rather sent his servants unto thee, to search the city, and to spy it out, and to overthrow it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore Hanun took David’s servants, and shaved off the half of their beard, and cut off their garments in the middle, even to their buttocks, and sent them away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it was told unto David, he sent to meet them (for the men were exceedingly ashamed) and the king said, Tarry at Jericho, until your beards be grown, then return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the children of Ammon saw that they stank in the sight of David, the children of Ammon sent and hired the Aramites of the house of Rehob, and the Aramites of Zoba, twenty thousand footmen, and of king Maacah a thousand men, and of Ish-Tob twelve thousand men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when David heard of it, he sent Joab, and all the host of the strong men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the children of Ammon came out and put their army in array at the entering in of the gate: and the Aramites of Zoba, and of Rehob, and of Ish-Tob, and of Maacah were by themselves in the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Joab saw that the front of the battle was against him before and behind, he chose of all the choice of Israel, and put them in array against the Aramites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the rest of the people, he delivered into the hand of Abishai his brother, that he might put them in array against the children of Ammon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, If the Aramites be stronger than I, thou shalt help me, and if the children of Ammon be too strong for thee, I will come and succor thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be strong and let us be valiant for our people, and for the cities of our God, and let the Lord do that which is good in his eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joab, and the people that was with him, joined in battle with the Aramites, who fled before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the children of Ammon saw that the Aramites fled, they fled also before Abishai, and entered into the city. So Joab returned from the children of Ammon, and came to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Aramites saw that they were smitten before Israel, they gathered them together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Hadarezer sent, and brought out the Aramites that were beyond the River: and they came to Helam, and Shobach the captain of the host of Hadadezer went before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it was showed David, then he gathered all Israel together, and passed over Jordan, and came to Helam: and the Aramites set themselves in array against David, and fought with him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Aramites fled before Israel: and David destroyed seven hundred chariots of the Aramites, and forty thousand horsemen, and smote Shobach the captain of his host, who died there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when all the kings, that were servants to Hadadezer, saw that they fell before Israel, they made peace with Israel, and served them. and the Aramites feared to help the children of Ammon anymore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the year was expired in the time when kings go forth to battle, David sent Joab, and his servants with him, and all Israel, who destroyed the children of Ammon, and besieged Rabbah: but David remained in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when it was evening-tide, David arose out of his bed, and walked upon the roof of the king’s palace: and from the roof he saw a woman washing herself: and the woman was very beautiful to look upon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David sent and inquired what woman it was: and one said, Is not this Bathsheba the daughter of Eliam, wife to Uriah the Hittite?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David sent messengers, and took her away: and she came unto him and he lay with her: (now she was purified from her uncleanness) and she returned unto her house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the woman conceived: therefore she sent and told David, and said, I am with child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David sent to Joab, saying, Send me Uriah the Hittite. And Joab sent Uriah to David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Uriah came unto him, David demanded him how Joab did, and how the people fared, and how the war prospered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward David said to Uriah, Go down to thine house, and wash thy feet. So Uriah departed out of the king’s palace, and the king sent a present after him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Uriah slept at the door of the king’s palace with all the servants of his lord, and went not down to his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they told David, saying, Uriah went not down to his house: and David said unto Uriah, Comest thou not from thy journey? why didst thou not go down to thine house?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Uriah answered David, The Ark and Israel, and Judah dwell in tents: and my lord Joab and the servants of my lord abide in the open fields: shall I then go into mine house to eat and drink, and lie with my wife? by thy life, and by the life of thy soul, I will not do this thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said unto Uriah, Tarry yet this day, and tomorrow I will send thee away. So Uriah abode in Jerusalem that day, and the morrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David called him, and he did eat and drink before him, and he made him drunk: and at even he went out to lie on his couch with the servants of his lord, but went not down to his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the morrow David wrote a letter to Joab, and sent it by the hand of Uriah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he wrote thus in the letter, Put ye Uriah in the forefront of the strength of the battle, and recule ye back from him, that he may be smitten, and die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when Joab besieged the city, he assigned Uriah unto a place, where he knew that strong men were.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the men of the city came out, and fought with Joab: and there fell of the people of the servants of David, and Uriah the Hittite also died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joab sent and told David all the things concerning the war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he charged the messenger, saying, When thou hast made an end of telling all the matters of the war unto the King,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if the king’s anger arise, so that he say unto thee, Wherefore approached ye unto the city to fight? knew ye not that they would hurl from the wall?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who smote Abimelech son of Jerubbesheth? did not a woman cast a piece of a millstone upon him from the wall, and he died in Thebez? why went you nigh the wall? Then say thou, Thy servant Uriah the Hittite is also dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the messenger went, and came and showed David all that Joab had sent him for.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the messenger said unto David, Certainly the men prevailed against us, and came out unto us into the field, but we pursued them unto the entering of the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the shooters shot from the wall against thy servants, and some of the king’s servants be dead: and thy servant Uriah the Hittite is also dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said unto the messenger, Thus shalt thou say unto Joab, Let not this thing trouble thee: for the sword devoureth one as well as another: make thy battle more strong against the city, and destroy it, and encourage thou him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the wife of Uriah heard that her husband Uriah was dead, she mourned for her husband.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when the mourning was past, David sent and took her into his house, and she became his wife, and bare him a son: but the thing that David had done, displeased the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord sent Nathan unto David, who came to him, and said unto him, There were two men in one city, the one rich, and the other poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rich man had exceedingly many sheep and oxen:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the poor had none at all, save one little sheep which he had bought and nourished up: and it grew up with him, and with his children also, and did eat of his own morsels, and drank of his own cup, and slept in his bosom, and was unto him as his daughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there came a stranger unto the rich man, who refused to take of his own sheep, and of his own oxen to dress for the stranger that was come unto him, but took the poor man’s sheep, and dressed it for the man that was come to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David was exceedingly wroth with the man, and said to Nathan, As the Lord liveth, the man that hath done this thing, shall surely die,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall restore the lamb fourfold, because he did this thing, and had no pity thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Nathan said to David, Thou art the man. Thus saith the Lord God of Israel, I anointed thee King over Israel, and delivered thee out of the hand of Saul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And gave thee thy lord’s house, and thy lord’s wives into thy bosom, and gave thee the house of Israel, and of Judah, and would moreover (if that had been too little) have given thee such and such things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore hast thou despised the commandment of the Lord, to do evil in his sight? thou hast killed Uriah the Hittite with the sword, and hast taken his wife to be thy wife, and hast slain him with the sword of the children of Ammon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore the sword shall never depart from thine house, because thou hast despised me, and taken the wife of Uriah the Hittite to be thy wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus said the Lord, Behold, I will raise up evil against thee out of thine own house, and will take thy wives before thine eyes, and give them unto thy neighbor, and he shall lie with thy wives in the sight of his sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thou diddest it secretly: but I will do this thing before all Israel, and before the sun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said unto Nathan, I have sinned against the Lord. And Nathan said unto David, The Lord also hath put away thy sin, thou shalt not die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Howbeit, because by this deed thou hast caused the enemies of the Lord to blaspheme, the child that is born unto thee, shall surely die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Nathan departed unto his house: and the Lord struck the child that Uriah’s wife bare unto David, and it was sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David therefore besought God for the child, and fasted and went in, and lay all night upon the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Elders of his house arose to come unto him, and to cause him to rise from the ground: but he would not, neither did he eat meat with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So on the seventh day the child died: and the servants of David feared to tell him that the child was dead: for they said, Behold, while the child was alive, we spake unto him, and he would not hearken unto our voice: how then shall we say unto him, The child is dead, to vex him more?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when David saw that his servants whispered, David perceived that the child was dead: therefore David said unto his servants, Is the child dead? And they said, He is dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David arose from the earth, and washed and anointed himself, and changed his apparel, and came into the house of the Lord, and worshipped, and afterward came to his own house, and bade that they should set bread before him, and he did eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said his servants unto him, What thing is this that thou hast done? thou didst fast and weep for the child while it was alive, but when the child was dead, thou didst rise up, and eat meat,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, While the child was yet alive, I fasted, and wept: for I said, Who can tell whether God will have mercy on me, that the child may live?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now being dead, wherefore should I now fast? Can I bring him again anymore? I shall go to him, but he shall not return to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David comforted Bathsheba his wife, and went in unto her, and lay with her, and she bare a son, and he called his name Solomon: also the Lord loved him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord had sent by Nathan the Prophet: therefore he called his name Jedidiah, because the Lord loved him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joab fought against Rabbah of the children of Ammon, and took the city of the Kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore Joab sent messengers to David, saying, I have fought against Rabbah, and have taken the city of waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, gather the rest of the people together, and besiege the city, that thou mayest take it, lest the victory be attributed to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David gathered all the people together, and went against Rabbah, and besieged it, and took it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took their king’s crown from his head, (which weighed a talent of gold, with precious stones) and it was set on David’s head: and he brought away the spoil of the city in exceedingly great abundance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he carried away the people that was therein, and put them under saws, and under iron harrows, and under axes of iron, and cast them into the tile-kiln: even thus did he with all the cities of the children of Ammon. Then David and all the people returned unto Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after this, so it was, that Absalom the son of David having a fair sister, whose name was Tamar, Amnon the son of David loved her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Amnon was so sore vexed, that he fell sick for his sister Tamar: for she was a virgin, and it seemed hard to Amnon to do anything to her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Amnon had a friend called Jonadab, the son of Shimeah David’s brother: and Jonadab was a very subtle man,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who said unto him, Why art thou the king’s son, so lean from day to day? wilt thou not tell me? Then Amnon answered him, I love Tamar my brother Absalom’s sister.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jonadab said unto him, Lie down on thy bed, and make thyself sick: and when thy father shall come to see thee, say unto him, I pray thee let my sister Tamar come, and give me meat, and let her dress meat in my sight, that I may see it, and eat it of her hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Amnon lay down, and made himself sick: and when the king came to see him, Amnon said unto the king, I pray thee, let Tamar my sister come, and make me a couple of cakes in my sight, that I may receive meat at her hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David sent home to Tamar, saying, Go now to thy brother Amnon’s house, and dress him meat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Tamar went to her brother Amnon’s house, and he lay down: and she took flour, and knead it, and made cakes in his sight, and did bake the cakes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she took a pan, and poured them out before him, but he would not eat. Then Amnon said, Cause ye every man to go out from me: so every man went out from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Amnon said unto Tamar, Bring the meat into the chamber, that I may eat of thine hand. And Tamar took the cakes which she had made, and brought them into the chamber to Amnon her brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when she had set them before him to eat, he took her, and said unto her, Come, lie with me, my sister.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But she answered him, Nay, my brother, do not force me: for no such thing ought to be done in Israel: commit not this folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I, whither shall I cause my shame to go? and thou shalt be as one of the fools in Israel: now therefore, I pray thee speak to the king, for he will not deny me unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Howbeit he would not hearken unto her voice, but being stronger than she, forced her, and lay with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Amnon hated her exceedingly, so that the hatred wherewith he hated her, was greater than the love wherewith he had loved her: and Amnon said unto her, Up, get thee hence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she answered him, There is no cause: this evil (to put me away) is greater than the other that thou didst unto me: but he would not hear her,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But called his servant that served him, and said, Put this woman now out from me, and lock the door after her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (And she had a garment of diverse colors upon her: for with such garments were the King’s daughters that were virgins, appareled) Then his servant brought her out, and locked the door after her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Tamar put ashes on her head, and rent the garment of diverse colors which was on her, and laid her hand on her head, and went her way crying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Absalom her brother said unto her, Hath Amnon thy brother been with thee? Now yet be still, my sister: he is thy brother: let not this thing grieve thine heart. So Tamar remained desolate in her brother Absalom’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when King David heard all these things, he was very wroth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Absalom said unto his brother Amnon neither good nor bad: for Absalom hated Amnon, because he had forced his sister Tamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after the time of two years, Absalom had sheepshearers in Baal Hazor, which is beside Ephraim, and Absalom called all the king’s sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Absalom came to the King, and said, Behold now, thy servant hath sheepshearers: I pray thee, that the king with his servants would go with thy servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the King answered Absalom, Nay my son, I pray thee, let us not go all, lest we be chargeable unto thee. Yet Absalom lay sore upon him: howbeit he would not go, but thanked him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Absalom, But, I pray thee, shall not my brother Amnon go with us? And the king answered him, Why should he go with thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Absalom was instant upon him, and he sent Amnon with him, and all the king’s children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now had Absalom commanded his servants, saying, Mark now when Amnon’s heart is merry with wine, and when I say unto you, Smite Amnon, kill him, fear not, for have not I commanded you? be bold therefore, and play the men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the servants of Absalom did unto Amnon, as Absalom had commanded: and all the king’s sons arose, and every man got him up upon his mule, and fled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while they were in the way, tidings came to David, saying, Absalom hath slain all the King’s sons, and there is not one of them left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king arose, and tore his garments, and lay on the ground, and all his servants stood by with their clothes rent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jonadab the son of Shimeah David’s brother answered and said, Let not my lord suppose that they have slain all the young men the King’s sons: for Amnon only is dead, because Absalom had reported so, since he forced his sister Tamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore let not my lord the King take the thing so grievously; to think that all the King’s sons are dead: for Amnon only is dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Absalom fled: and the young man that kept the watch, lift up his eyes, and looked, and behold, there came much people by the way of the hill side behind him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jonadab said unto the king, Behold, the king’s sons come: as thy servant said, so it is.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as soon as he had left speaking, behold, the king’s sons came, and lift up their voices, and wept: and the king also and all his servants wept exceedingly sore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Absalom fled away, and went to Talmai the son of Ammihud king of Geshur: and David mourned for his son every day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Absalom fled, and went to Geshur, and was there three years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And king David desired to go forth unto Absalom, because he was pacified concerning Amnon, seeing he was dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joab the son of Zeruiah perceived, that the king’s heart was toward Absalom,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joab sent to Tekoa, and brought thence a subtle woman, and said unto her, I pray thee, feign thyself to mourn, and now put on mourning apparel, and anoint not thyself with oil: but be as a woman that had now long time mourned for the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And come to the king, and speak on this manner unto him, (for Joab taught her what she should say).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the woman of Tekoa spake unto the king, and fell down on her face to the ground, and did obeisance, and said, Help, O King.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king said unto her, What aileth thee? And she answered, I am indeed a widow, and mine husband is dead:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thine handmaid had two sons, and they two strove together in the field, (and there was none to part them) so the one smote the other, and slew him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold the whole family is risen against thine handmaid, and they said, Deliver him that smote his brother, that we may kill him for the soul of his brother whom he slew, that we may destroy the heir also: so they shall quench my sparkle which is left, and shall not leave to mine husband neither name nor posterity upon the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the king said unto the woman, Go to thine house, and I will give a charge for thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the woman of Tekoa said unto the King, My lord, O King, this trespass be on me, and on my father’s house, and the King and his throne be guiltless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the King said, Bring him to me that speaketh against thee, and he shall touch thee no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said she, I pray thee, let the king remember the Lord thy God, that thou wouldest not suffer many revengers of blood to destroy, lest they slay my son. And he answered, As the Lord liveth, there shall not one hair of thy son fall to the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the woman said, I pray thee, let thine handmaid speak a word to my lord the King. And he said, Say on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the woman said, Wherefore then hast thou thought such a thing against the people of God? or why doth the King, as one which is faulty, speak this thing, that he will not bring again his banished?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we must needs die, and we are as water spilt on the ground, which cannot be gathered up again: neither doth God spare any person, yet doth he appoint means, not to cast out from him, him that is expelled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, that I am come to speak of this thing unto my lord the King, the cause is that the people have made me afraid: therefore thine handmaid said, Now will I speak unto the King: it may be that the king will perform the request of his handmaid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the king will hear, to deliver his handmaid out of the hand of the man that would destroy me, and also my son from the inheritance of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore thine handmaid said, The word of my lord the king shall now be comfortable: for my lord the King is even as an Angel of God in hearing of good and bad: therefore the Lord thy God be with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king answered, and said unto the woman, Hide not from me, I pray thee, the thing that I shall ask thee. And the woman said, Let my lord the king now speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the king said, Is not the hand of Joab with thee in all this? Then the woman answered, and said, As thy soul liveth, my lord the King, I will not turn to the right hand nor to the left, from ought that my lord the king hath spoken: for even thy servant Joab bade me, and he put all these words in the mouth of thine handmaid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For to the intent that I should change the form of speech, thy servant Joab hath done this thing: but my lord is wise according to the wisdom of an Angel of God, to understand all things that are in the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the king said unto Joab, Behold now, I have done this thing: go then, and bring the young man Absalom again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joab fell to the ground on his face, and bowed himself and thanked the King. Then Joab said, This day thy servant knoweth, that I have found grace in thy sight, my lord the king, in that the king hath fulfilled the request of his servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joab arose, and went to Geshur, and brought Absalom to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the King said, Let him turn to his own house, and not see my face. So Absalom turned to his own house, and saw not the king’s face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in all Israel there was none to be so much praised for beauty as Absalom: from the sole of his foot even to the top of his head there was no blemish in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he polled his head, (for at every year’s end he polled it: because it was too heavy for him, therefore he polled it) he weighed the hair of his head at two hundred shekels by the king’s weight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Absalom had three sons, and one daughter named Tamar, which was a fair woman to look upon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Absalom dwelt the space of two years in Jerusalem, and saw not the king’s face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore Absalom sent for Joab to send him to the King, but he would not come to him: and when he sent again, he would not come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore he said unto his servants, Behold, Joab hath a field by my place, and hath barley therein: go, and set it on fire: and Absalom’s servants set the field on fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joab arose, and came to Absalom unto his house, and said unto him, Wherefore have thy servants burnt my field with fire?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Absalom answered Joab, Behold, I sent for thee, saying, Come thou hither, and I will send thee to the king for to say, Wherefore am I come from Geshur? It had been better for me to have been there still: now therefore let me see the king’s face: and if there be any trespass in me, let him kill me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joab came to the king, and told him: and he called for Absalom, who came to the king, and bowed himself to the ground on his face before the king, and the king kissed Absalom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, Absalom prepared him chariots, and horses, and fifty men to run before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Absalom rose up early, and stood hard by the entering in of the gate: and every man that had any matter, and came to the king for judgment, him did Absalom call unto him, and said, Of what city art thou? And he answered, Thy servant is of one of the tribes of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Absalom said unto him, See, thy matters are good and righteous, but there is no man deputed of the king to hear thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Absalom said moreover, Oh that I were made Judge in the land, that every man which hath any matter of controversy, might come to me, that I might do him justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when any man came near to him, and did him obeisance, he put forth his hand, and took him, and kissed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on this manner did Absalom to all Israel, that came to the King for judgment: so Absalom stole the hearts of the men of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after forty years, Absalom said unto the King, I pray thee, let me go to Hebron, and render my vow which I have vowed unto the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thy servant vowed a vow when I remained at Geshur, in Aram, saying, If the Lord shall bring me again indeed to Jerusalem, I will serve the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the King said unto him, Go in peace. So he arose, and went to Hebron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Absalom sent spies throughout all the tribes of Israel, saying, When ye hear the sound of the trumpet, ye shall say, Absalom reigneth in Hebron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And with Absalom went two hundred men out of Jerusalem, that were called: and they went in their simplicity, knowing nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also Absalom sent for Ahithophel the Gilonite David’s counselor, from his city Giloh, while he offered sacrifices: and the treason was great: for the people increased still with Absalom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came a messenger to David, saying, The hearts of the men of Israel are turned after Absalom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said unto all his servants that were with him at Jerusalem, Up, and let us flee: for we shall not escape from Absalom: make speed to depart, lest he come suddenly and take us, and bring evil upon us, and smite the city with the edge of the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the king’s servants said unto him, Behold, thy servants are ready to do according to all that my lord the king shall appoint.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the king departed and all his household after him, and the king left ten concubines to keep the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the king went forth and all the people after him, and tarried in a place far off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all his servants went about him, and all the Cherethites and all the Pelethites, and all the Gittites, even six hundred men which were come after him from Gath, went before the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said the King to Ittai the Gittite, Wherefore comest thou also with us? Return and abide with the King, for thou art a stranger, depart thou therefore to thy place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou camest yesterday, and should I cause thee to wander today and go with us? I will go whither I can: therefore return thou, and carry again thy brethren: mercy and truth be with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Ittai answered the King, and said, As the Lord liveth, and as my lord the king liveth, in what place my lord the king shall be, whether in death or life, even there surely will thy servant be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said to Ittai, Come, and go forward. And Ittai the Gittite went, and all his men, and all the children that were with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the country wept with a loud voice, and all the people went forward, but the King passed over the brook Kidron: and all the people went over toward the way of the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And lo, Zadok also was there, and all the Levites with him, bearing the Ark of the covenant of God: and they set down the Ark of God: and Abiathar went up until the people were all come out of the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the King said unto Zadok, Carry the Ark of God again into the city: if I shall find favor in the eyes of the Lord, he will bring me again, and show me both it, and the Tabernacle thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he thus say, I have no delight in thee, behold, here am I, let him do to me as seemeth good in his eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The King said again unto Zadok the Priest, Art not thou a Seer? return into the city in peace, and your two sons with you: to wit, Ahimaaz thy son, and Jonathan the son of Abiathar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I will tarry in the fields of the wilderness, until there come some word from you to be told me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zadok therefore and Abiathar carried the Ark of God again to Jerusalem, and they tarried there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David went up the mount of olives, and wept as he went up, and had his head covered, and went barefooted: and all the people that was with him, had every man his head covered, and as they went up, they wept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one told David, saying, Ahithophel is one of them that have conspired with Absalom: and David said, O Lord, I pray thee, turn the counsel of Ahithophel into foolishness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David came to the top of the mount where he worshipped God: and behold, Hushai the Archite came against him with his coat torn, and having earth upon his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Unto whom David said, If thou go with me, thou shalt be a burthen unto me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if thou return to the city, and say unto Absalom, I will be thy servant, O King (as I have been in time past thy father’s servant, so will I now be thy servant) then thou mayest bring me the counsel of Ahithophel to nought.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And hast thou not there with thee Zadok and Abiathar the Priests? therefore whatsoever thou shalt hear out of the King’s house, thou shalt show to Zadok and Abiathar the Priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, there are with them their two sons: Ahimaaz Zadok’s son, and Jonathan Abiathar’s son: by them also shall ye send me everything that ye can hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Hushai David’s friend went into the city: and Absalom came into Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When David was a little past the top of the hill, behold, Ziba the servant of Mephibosheth met him with a couple of asses saddled, and upon them two hundred cakes of bread, and an hundred bunches of raisins, and an hundred of dried figs, and a bottle of wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the King said unto Ziba, What meanest thou by these? And Ziba said, They be asses for the king’s household to ride on, and bread, and dried figs for the young men to eat, and wine, that the faint may drink in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the King said, But where is thy master’s son? Then Ziba answered the King, Behold, he remaineth in Jerusalem: for he said, This day shall the house of Israel restore me the kingdom of my father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said the King to Ziba, Behold, thine are all that pertained unto Mephibosheth. And Ziba said, I beseech thee, let me find grace in thy sight, my lord, O King.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when King David came to Bahurim, behold, thence came out a man of the family of the house of Saul, named Shimei, the son of Gera: and he came out and cursed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he cast stones at David, and at all the servants of King David: and all the people, and all the men of war were on his right hand, and on his left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thus said Shimei when he cursed, Come forth, come forth thou murderer, and wicked man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord hath brought upon thee all the blood of the house of Saul, in whose stead thou hast reigned: and the Lord hath delivered thy kingdom into the hand of Absalom thy son: and behold, thou art taken in thy wickedness, because thou art a murderer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Abishai the son of Zeruiah unto the King, Why doth this dead dog curse my lord the King: let me go, I pray thee, and take away his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the King said, What have I to do with you, ye sons of Zeruiah? for he curseth, even because the Lord hath bidden him curse David: who dare then say, Wherefore hast thou done so?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David said to Abishai, and to all his servants, Behold, my son which came out of mine own bowels, seeketh my life: then how much more now may this son of Benjamin? Suffer him to curse: for the Lord hath bidden him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It may be that the Lord will look on mine affliction, and do me good for his cursing this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as David and his men went by the way, Shimei went by the side of the mountain over against him, and cursed as he went, and threw stones against him, and cast dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came the King and all the people that were with him weary, and refreshed themselves there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Absalom, and all the people the men of Israel, came to Jerusalem, and Ahithophel with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Hushai the Archite, David’s friend, was come unto Absalom, Hushai said unto Absalom, God save the King, God save the King.
verses.speaker: Narrator
