verses.text: Then Absalom said to Hushai, Is this thy kindness to thy friend? Why wentest thou not with thy friend?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hushai then answered unto Absalom, Nay, but whom the Lord, and this people, and all the men of Israel choose, his will I be, and with them will I dwell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And moreover, unto whom shall I do service? not to his son? as I served before thy father, so will I before thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then spake Absalom to Ahithophel, Give counsel what we shall do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Ahithophel said unto Absalom, Go in to thy father’s concubines, which he hath left to keep the house: and when all Israel shall hear that thou art abhorred of thy father, the hands of all that are with thee, shall be strong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they spread Absalom a tent upon the top of the house, and Absalom went in to his father’s concubines in the sight of all Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the counsel of Ahithophel which he counseled in those days, was like as one had asked counsel at the oracle of God: so was all the counsel of Ahithophel both with David and with Absalom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, Ahithophel said to Absalom, Let me choose out now twelve thousand men, and I will up and follow after David this night,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will come upon him: for he is weary, and weak handled: so I will fear him, and all the people that are with him shall flee, and I will smite the king only,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will bring again all the people unto thee, and when all shall return, (the man whom thou seekest being slain) all the people shall be in peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the saying pleased Absalom well, and all the Elders of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Absalom, Call now Hushai the Archite also, and let us hear likewise what he saith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when Hushai came to Absalom, Absalom spake unto him, saying, Ahithophel hath spoken thus: shall we do after his saying, or no? tell thou.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hushai then answered unto Absalom, The counsel that Ahithophel hath given, is not good at this time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For, said Hushai, thou knowest thy father, and his men, that they be strong men, and are chafed in mind as a bear robbed of her whelps in the field: also thy father is a valiant warrior, and will not lodge with the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, he is hid now in some cave, or in some place: and though some of them be overthrown at the first, yet the people shall hear, and say, The people that follow Absalom, be overthrown.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he also that is valiant, whose heart is as the heart of a lion, shall shrink and faint: for all Israel knoweth that thy father is valiant, and they which be with him, stout men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore my counsel is, that all Israel be gathered unto thee, from Dan even to Beersheba as the sand of the Sea in number, and that thou go to battle in thine own person.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So shall we come upon him in some place, where we shall find him, and we will upon him as the dew falleth on the ground: and of all the men that are with him, we will not leave him one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, if he be gotten into a city, then shall all the men of Israel bring ropes to that city, and we will draw it into the river, until there be not one small stone found there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Absalom and all the men of Israel said, The counsel of Hushai the Archite, is better, than the counsel of Ahithophel: for the Lord had determined to destroy the good counsel of Ahithophel, that the Lord might bring evil upon Absalom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Hushai unto Zadok and to Abiathar the Priests, Of this and that manner did Ahithophel and the Elders of Israel counsel Absalom: and thus and thus have I counseled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore send quickly, and show David, saying, Tarry not this night in the fields of the wilderness, but rather get thee over, lest the king be devoured, and all the people that are with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jonathan and Ahimaaz abode by En Rogel: (for they might not be seen to come into the city) and a maid went, and told them, and they went and showed king David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, a young man saw them, and told it to Absalom. Therefore they both departed quickly, and came to a man’s house in Bahurim, who had a well in his court, into the which they went down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the wife took and spread a covering over the well’s mouth, and spread ground corn thereon, that the thing should not be known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Absalom’s servants came to the wife into the house, they said, Where is Ahimaaz and Jonathan? And the woman answered them, They be gone over the brook of water. And when they had sought them, and could not find them, they returned to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as soon as they were departed, the other came out of the well, and went and told king David, and said unto him, Up, and get you quickly over the water: for such counsel hath Ahithophel given against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David arose, and all the people that were with him, and they went over Jordan until the dawning of the day, so that there lacked not one of them, that was not come over Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Ahithophel saw that his counsel was not followed, he saddled his ass, and arose, and he went home unto his city, and put his household in order, and hanged himself, and died, and was buried in his father’s grave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David came to Mahanaim. And Absalom passed over Jordan, he, and all the men of Israel with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Absalom made Amasa captain of the host in the stead of Joab: which Amasa was a man’s son named Jithra, an Israelite, that went in to Abigail the daughter of Nahash, sister to Zeruiah Joab’s mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Israel and Absalom pitched in the land of Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when David was come to Mahanaim, Shobi the son of Nahash out of Rabbah of the children of Ammon, and Machir the son of Ammiel out of Lo Debar, and Barzillai the Gileadite out of Rogelim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brought beds, and basins, and earthen vessels, and wheat, and barley, and flour, and parched corn, and beans, and lentils, and parched corn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they brought honey, and butter, and sheep, and cheese of kine for David, and for the people that were with him, to eat: for they said, The people is hungry, and weary, and thirsty in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David numbered the people that were with him, and set over them captains of thousands, and captains of hundreds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David sent forth the third part of the people under the hand of Joab, and the third part under the hand of Abishai Joab’s brother, the son of Zeruiah: and the other third part under the hand of Ittai the Gittite. And the King said unto the people, I will go with you myself also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the people answered, Thou shalt not go forth: for if we flee away, they will not regard us, neither will they pass for us, though half of us were slain: but thou art now worth ten thousand of us: therefore now it is better that thou succor us out of the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king said unto them, What seemeth you best, that I will do. So the king stood by the gate side, and all the people came out by hundreds and by thousands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the king commanded Joab and Abishai, and Ittai, saying, Entreat the young man Absalom gently for my sake. And all the people heard when the King gave all the Captains charge concerning Absalom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people went out into the field to meet Israel, and the battle was in the wood of Ephraim:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where the people of Israel were slain before the servants of David: so there was a great slaughter that day, even of twenty thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the battle was scattered over all the country: and the wood devoured much more people that day than did the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Absalom met the servants of David, and Absalom rode upon a mule, and the mule came under a great thick oak: and his head caught hold of the oak, and he was taken up between the heaven and the earth: and the mule that was under him went away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one that saw it, told Joab, saying, Behold, I saw Absalom hanged in an oak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joab said unto the man that told him, And hast thou indeed seen? why then didst thou not there smite him to the ground, and I would have given thee ten shekels of silver, and a girdle?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the man said unto Joab, Though I should receive a thousand shekels of silver in mine hand, yet would I not lay mine hand upon the King’s son: for in our hearing the King charged thee, and Abishai, and Ittai, saying, Beware, lest any touch the young man Absalom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I had done it, it had been the danger of my life: for nothing can be hid from the King: yea, thou thyself wouldest have been against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Joab, I will not thus tarry with thee. And he took three darts in his hand, and thrust them through Absalom, while he was yet alive in the midst of the oak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ten servants that bare Joab’s armor, compassed about and smote Absalom, and slew him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joab blew the trumpet, and the people returned from pursuing after Israel: for Joab held back the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they took Absalom, and cast him into a great pit in the wood, and laid a mighty great heap of stones upon him: and all Israel fled every one to his tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Absalom in his life time had taken and reared him up a pillar, which is in the King’s dale: for he said, I have no son to keep my name in remembrance: and he called the pillar after his own name, and it is called unto this day, Absalom’s place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Ahimaaz the son of Zadok, I pray thee, let me run and bear the King tidings that the Lord hath delivered him out of the hand of his enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joab said unto him, Thou shalt not be the messenger today, but thou shalt bear tidings another time, but today thou shalt bear none: for the King’s son is dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Joab to Cushi, Go, tell the King, what thou hast seen. And Cushi bowed himself unto Joab, and ran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Ahimaaz the son of Zadok again to Joab, What, I pray thee, if I also run after Cushi? And Joab said, Wherefore now wilt thou run my son, seeing that thou hast no tidings to bring?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet what if I run? Then he said unto him, Run. So Ahimaaz ran by the way of the plain, and overwent Cushi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now David sat between the two gates. And the watchman went to the top of the gate upon the wall, and lift up his eyes, and saw, and behold, a man came running alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the watchman cried, and told the king. And the King said, If he be alone, he bringeth tidings. And he came apace, and drew near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the watchman saw another man running, and the watchman called unto the potter, and said, Behold, another man runneth alone. And the King said, He also bringeth tidings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the watchman said, Me thinketh the running of the foremost is like the running of Ahimaaz the son of Zadok. Then the King said, He is a good man, and cometh with good tidings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Ahimaaz called, and said unto the King, Peace be with thee: and he fell down to the earth upon his face before the King, and said, Blessed be the Lord thy God, who hath shut up the men that lift up their hands against my Lord the King.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the King said, Is the young man Absalom safe? And Ahimaaz answered, When Joab sent the King’s servant, and me thy servant, I saw a great tumult, but I knew not what.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the King said unto him, Turn aside, and stand here: so he turned aside and stood still.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, Cushi came, and Cushi said, Tidings, my lord the King: for the Lord hath delivered thee this day out of the hand of all that rose against thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the King said unto Cushi, Is the young man Absalom safe? And Cushi answered, The enemies of my lord the King, and all that rise against thee to do thee hurt, be as that young man is.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the King was moved, and went up to the chamber over the gate, and wept: and as he went, thus he said, O my son Absalom, my son, my son Absalom: would God I had died for thee, O Absalom, my son, my son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it was told Joab, Behold, the King weepeth and mourneth for Absalom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the victory of that day was turned into mourning to all the people: for the people heard say that day, The King sorroweth for his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people went that day into the city secretly, as people confounded hide themselves when they flee in battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the King hid his face, and the king cried with a loud voice, My son Absalom, Absalom my son, my son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joab came into the house to the King, and said, Thou hast shamed this day the faces of all thy servants, which this day have saved thy life, and the lives of thy sons, and of thy daughters, and the lives of thy wives, and the lives of thy concubines,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that thou lovest thine enemies, and hatest thy friends: for thou hast declared this day, that thou regardest neither thy princes, nor servants: therefore this day I perceive, that if Absalom had lived, and we all had died this day, that then it would have pleased thee well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore up, come out, and speak comfortably unto thy servants: for I swear by the Lord, except thou come out, there will not tarry one man with thee this night: and that will be worse unto thee, than all the evil that fell on thee from thy youth hitherto.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king arose, and sat in the gate: and they told unto all the people, saying, Behold, the king doth sit in the gate: and all the people came before the king: for Israel had fled every man to his tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the people were at strife throughout all the tribes of Israel, saying, The King saved us out of the hand of our enemies, and he delivered us out of the hand of the Philistines, and now he is fled out of the land for Absalom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Absalom, whom we anointed over us, is dead in battle: therefore why are ye so slow to bring the king again?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But King David sent to Zadok and to Abiathar the Priests, saying, Speak unto the Elders of Judah, and say, Why are ye behind to bring the King again to his house (for the saying of all Israel is come unto the King, even to his house.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye are my brethren: my bones and my flesh are ye: Wherefore then are ye the last that bring the King again?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also say ye to Amasa, Art thou not my bone and my flesh? God do so to me, and more also, if thou be not captain of the host to me forever in the room of Joab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he bowed the hearts of all the men of Judah, as of one man: therefore they sent to the King, saying, Return thou with all thy servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the king returned, and came to Jordan. And Judah came to Gilgal, for to go to meet the king, and to conduct him over Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Shimei the son of Gera, the son of Benjamin, which was of Bahurim, hasted and came down with the men of Judah to meet king David,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a thousand men of Benjamin with him, and Ziba the servant of the house of Saul, and his fifteen sons and twenty servants with him: and they went over Jordan before the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there went over a boat to carry over the king’s household, and to do him pleasure. Then Shimei the son of Gera fell before the king, when he was come over Jordan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And said unto the king, Let not my lord impute wickedness unto me, nor remember the thing that thy servant did wickedly when my lord the King departed out of Jerusalem, that the king should take it to his heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thy servant doth know, that I have done amiss: therefore behold, I am the first this day of all the house of Joseph, that am come to go down to meet my lord the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Abishai the son of Zeruiah answered, and said, Shall not Shimei die for this, because he cursed the Lord’s anointed?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David said, What have I to do with you, ye sons of Zeruiah, that this day ye should be adversaries unto me? shall there any man die this day in Israel? for do not I know that I am this day king over Israel?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the king said unto Shimei, Thou shalt not die, and the king swore unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Mephibosheth the son of Saul came down to meet the king, and had neither washed his feet, nor dressed his beard, nor washed his clothes from the time the king departed, until he returned in peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he was come to Jerusalem, and met the king, the king said unto him, Wherefore wentest not thou with me, Mephibosheth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered, My lord the King, my servant deceived me: for thy servant said, I would have mine ass saddled to ride thereon, for to go with the king, because thy servant is lame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he hath accused thy servant unto my lord the king: but my lord the king is as an angel of God: do therefore thy pleasure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all my father’s house were but dead men before my lord the king, yet didst thou set thy servant among them that did eat at thine own table: what right therefore have I yet to cry anymore unto the king?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the king said unto him, Why speakest thou anymore of thy matters? I have said, Thou, and Ziba, divide the lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Mephibosheth said unto the king, Yea, let him take all, seeing my lord the king is come home in peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Barzillai the Gileadite came down from Rogelim, and went over Jordan with the king, to conduct him over Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Barzillai was a very aged man, even fourscore years old, and he had provided the king of sustenance, while he lay at Mahanaim: for he was a man of very great substance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the king said unto Barzillai, Come over with me, and I will feed thee with me in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Barzillai said unto the king, How long have I to live, that I should go up with the king to Jerusalem?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am this day fourscore years old: and can I discern between good or evil? Hath thy servant any taste in that I eat, or in that I drink? Can I hear anymore the voice of singing men and women? wherefore then should thy servant be anymore a burthen unto my lord the king?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thy servant will go a little way over Jordan with the king, and why will the king recompense it me with such a reward?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I pray thee, let thy servant turn back again, that I may die in mine own city, and be buried in the grave of my father and of my mother: but behold thy servant Chimham, let him go with my lord the King, and do to him what shall please thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the king answered, Chimham shall go with me, and I will do to him that thou shalt be content with: and whatsoever thou shalt require of me, that will I do for thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all the people went over Jordan: and the king passed over: and the king kissed Barzillai, and blessed him, and he returned unto his own place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the King went to Gilgal, and Chimham went with him, and all the people of Judah conducted the king, and also half the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, all the men of Israel came to the king, and said unto the king, Why have our brethren the men of Judah stolen thee away, and have brought the king and his household, and all David’s men with him over Jordan?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the men of Judah answered the men of Israel, Because the king is near of kin to us: and wherefore now be ye angry for this matter? have we eaten of the king’s cost, or have we taken any bribes?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the men of Israel answered the men of Judah, and said, We have ten parts in the king, and have also more right to David than ye: Why then did ye despise us that our advise should not be first had in restoring our king? And the words of the men of Judah were fiercer than the words of the men of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then there was come thither a wicked man (named Sheba the son of Bichri, a man of Benjamin) and he blew the trumpet, and said, We have no part in David, neither have we inheritance in the son of Ishai: every man to his tents, O Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So every man of Israel went from David and followed Sheba the son of Bichri: but the men of Judah clave fast unto their King, from Jordan even to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When David then came to his house to Jerusalem, the king took the ten women his concubines, that he had left behind him to keep the house, and put them in ward, and fed them, but lay no more with them: but they were enclosed unto the day of their death, living in widowhood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said the King to Amasa, Assemble me the men of Judah within three days, and be thou here present.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Amasa went to assemble Judah, but he tarried longer than the time which he had appointed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said to Abishai, Now shall Sheba the son of Bichri do us more harm than did Absalom: take thou therefore thy lord’s servants and follow after him, lest he get him walled cities, and escape us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there went out after him Joab’s men, and the Cherethites and the Pelethites, and all the mighty men: and they departed out of Jerusalem, to follow after Sheba the son of Bichri.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they were at the great stone, which is in Gibeon, Amasa went before them, and Joab’s garment, that he had put on, was girded unto him, and upon it was a sword girded, which hanged on his loins in the sheath, and as he went, it used to fall out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joab said to Amasa, Art thou in health, my brother? and Joab took Amasa by the beard with the right hand to kiss him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Amasa took no heed to the sword that was in Joab’s hand: for therewith he smote him in the fifth rib, and shed out his bowels to the ground, and smote him not the second time: so he died: then Joab and Abishai his brother followed after Sheba the son of Bichri.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one of Joab’s men stood by him, and said, He that favoreth Joab, and he that is of David’s part, let him go after Joab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Amasa wallowed in blood in the midst of the way: and when the man saw that all the people stood still, he removed Amasa out of the way into the field, and cast a cloth upon him, because he saw that everyone that came by him, stood still.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he was removed out of the way, every man went after Joab, to follow after Sheba the son of Bichri.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went through all the tribes of Israel unto Abel, and Beth Maachah and all places of Berim: and they gathered together, and went also after him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they came, and besieged him in Abel, near to Beth Maachah, and they cast up a mount against the city, and the people thereof stood on the rampart, and all the people that was with Joab, destroyed and cast down the wall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then cried a wise woman out of the city, Hear, hear, I pray you, say unto Joab, Come thou hither, that I may speak with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he came near unto her, the woman said, Art thou Joab? And he answered, Yea. And she said to him, Hear the words of thine handmaid. And he answered, I do hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then she spake thus, They spake in the old time, saying, They should ask of Abel: and so they have continued.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am one of them that are peaceable, and faithful in Israel: and thou goest about to destroy a city, and a mother in Israel: why wilt thou devour the inheritance of the Lord?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joab answered, and said, God forbid, God forbid it me, that I should devour, or destroy it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The matter is not so, but a man of mount Ephraim (Sheba the son of Bichri by name) hath lift up his hand against the king, even against David: deliver us him only, and I will depart from the city. And the woman said unto Joab, Behold, his head shall be thrown to thee over the wall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the woman went unto all the people with her wisdom, and they cut off the head of Sheba the son of Bichri, and cast it to Joab: then he blew the trumpet, and they retired from the city, every man to his tent: and Joab returned to Jerusalem unto the King.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joab was over all the host of Israel, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada over the Cherethites, and over the Pelethites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Adoram over the tribute, and Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud the Recorder,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Sheva was Scribe, and Zadok and Abiathar the Priests
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And also Ira the Jairite was chief about David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then there was a famine in the days of David, three years together: and David asked counsel of the Lord, and the Lord answered, It is for Saul, and for his bloody house, because he slew the Gibeonites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the King called the Gibeonites, and said unto them, (Now the Gibeonites were not of the children of Israel, but a remnant of the Amorites, unto whom the children of Israel had sworn: but Saul sought to slay them for his zeal toward the children of Israel and Judah)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David said unto the Gibeonites, What shall I do for you, and wherewith shall I make the atonement, that ye may bless the inheritance of the Lord?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Gibeonites then answered him, We will have no silver nor gold of Saul nor of his house, neither for us shalt thou kill any man in Israel. And he said, What ye shall say that will I do for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they answered the king, The man that consumed us, and that imagined evil against us, so that we are destroyed from remaining in any coast of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let seven men of his sons be delivered unto us, and we will hang them up unto the Lord in Gibeah of Saul, the Lord’s chosen, And the king said, I will give them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the king had compassion on Mephibosheth the son of Jonathan the son of Saul, because of the Lord’s oath, that was between them, even between David and Jonathan the son of Saul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the king took the two sons of Rizpah the daughter of Aiah, whom she bare unto Saul, even Armoni and Mephibosheth, and the five sons of Michal, the daughter of Saul, whom she bare to Adriel the son of Barzillai the Meholathite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he delivered them unto the hands of the Gibeonites, which hanged them in the mountain before the Lord: so they died all seven together: and they were slain in the time of harvest: in the first days, and in the beginning of barley harvest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Rizpah the daughter of Aiah took sackcloth and hanged it up for her upon the rock, from the beginning of harvest, until water dropped upon them from the heaven, and suffered neither the birds of the air to light on them by day, nor beasts of the field by night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it was told David, what Rizpah the daughter of Aiah the concubine of Saul had done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David went and took the bones of Saul, and the bones of Jonathan his son from the citizens of Jabesh Gilead, which had stolen them from the street of Beth Shan, where the Philistines had hanged them, when the Philistines had slain Saul in Gilboa.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he brought thence the bones of Saul, and the bones of Jonathan his son, and they gathered the bones of them that were hanged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the bones of Saul and of Jonathan his son buried they in the country of Benjamin in Zelah, in the grave of Kish his father: and when they had performed all that the King had commanded, God was then appeased with the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again the Philistines hath war with Israel: and David went down, and his servants with him, and they fought against the Philistines, and David fainted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Ishbi-Benob which was of the sons of Haraphah (the head of whose spear weighed three hundred shekels of brass) even he being girded with a new sword, thought to have slain David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Abishai the son of Zeruiah succored him, and smote the Philistine, and killed him. Then David’s men swore unto him, saying, Thou shalt go no more out with us to battle, lest thou quench the light of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after this also there was a battle with the Philistines at Gob, then Sibbechai the Hushathite slew Saph, which was one of the sons of Haraphah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was yet another battle in Gob with the Philistines, where Elhanan the son of Jaare-Oregim, a Bethlehemite slew Goliath the Gittite: the staff of whose spear was like a weaver’s beam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward there was also a battle in Gath, where was a man of a great stature, and had on every hand six fingers, and on every foot six toes, four and twenty in number: who was also the son of Haraphah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he reviled Israel, Jonathan the son of Shimea the brother of David slew him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These four were born to Haraphah in Gath, and died by the hand of David, and by the hands of his servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David spake the words of this song unto the Lord, what time the Lord had delivered him out of the hands of all his enemies, and out of the hand of Saul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, The Lord is my rock and my fortress, and he that delivereth me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God is my strength, in him will I trust: my shield, and the horn of my salvation, my high tower and my refuge: my Savior, thou hast saved me from violence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will call on the Lord, who is worthy to be praised: so shall I be safe from mine enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the pangs of death have compassed me: the floods of ungodliness have made me afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sorrows of the grave compassed me about: the snares of death overtook me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But in my tribulation did I call upon the Lord, and cry to my God, and he did hear my voice out of his Temple, and my cry did enter into his ears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the earth trembled and quaked: the foundations of the heavens moved and shook, because he was angry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Smoke went out at his nostrils, and consuming fire out of his mouth: coals were kindled thereat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He bowed the heavens also, and came down, and darkness was under his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he rode upon Cherub and did fly, and he was seen upon the wings of the wind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made darkness a Tabernacle round about him, even the gatherings of waters, and the clouds of the air.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the brightness of his presence the coals of fire were kindled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord thundered from heaven, and the most High gave his voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shot arrows also, and scattered them: to wit, lightning, and destroyed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The channels also of the sea appeared, even the foundations of the world were discovered by the rebuking of the Lord, and at the blast of the breath of his nostrils.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sent from above, and took me: he drew me out of many waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He delivered me from my strong enemy, and from them that hated me: for they were too strong for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They prevented me in the day of my calamity, but the Lord was my stay,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And brought me forth into a large place: he delivered me, because he favored me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord rewarded me according to my righteousness: according to the pureness of mine hands he recompensed me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I kept the ways of the Lord, and did not wickedly against my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all his laws were before me, and his statutes: I did not depart therefrom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was upright also toward him, and have kept me from my wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the Lord did reward me according to my righteousness, according to my pureness before his eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With the godly thou wilt show thyself godly: with the upright man thou wilt show thyself upright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With the pure thou wilt show thyself pure, and with the froward thou wilt show thyself froward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus thou wilt save the poor people: but thine eyes are upon the haughty, to humble them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely thou art my light, O Lord: and the Lord will lighten my darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For by thee have I broken through an host, and by my God have I leaped over a wall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The way of God is uncorrupt: the word of the Lord is tried in the fire: he is a shield to all that trust in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For who is God besides the Lord? and who is mighty, save our God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God is my strength in battle, and maketh my way upright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He maketh my feet like hinds feet, and hath set me upon mine high places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He teacheth mine hands to fight, so that a bowl of brass is broken with mine arms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast also given me the shield of thy salvation, and thy loving kindness hath caused me to increase.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast enlarged my steps under me, and mine heels have not slid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have pursued mine enemies, and destroyed them, and have not turned again until I had consumed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yea, I have consumed them and thrust them through, and they shall not arise, but shall fall under my feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thou hast girded me with power to battle, and them that rose against me, hast thou subdued under me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou hast given me the necks of mine enemies, that I might destroy them that hate me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They looked about, but there was none to save them, even unto the Lord, but he answered them not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then did I beat them as small as the dust of the earth: I did tread them flat as the clay of the street, and did spread them abroad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast also delivered me from the contentions of my people: thou hast preserved me to be the head over nations: the people which I knew not, do serve me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Strangers shall be in subjection to me: as soon as they hear, they shall obey me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Strangers shall shrink away, and fear in their privy chambers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the Lord live, and blessed be my strength: and God, even the force of my salvation be exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is God that giveth me power to revenge me, and subdue the people under me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And rescueth me from mine enemies: (thou also hast lift me up from them that rose against me, thou hast delivered me from the cruel man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I will praise thee, O Lord, among the nations, and will sing unto thy Name.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is the tower of salvation for his King, and showeth mercy to his anointed, even to David, and to his seed forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These also be the last words of David, David the son of Jesse saith, even the man who was set up on high, the anointed of the God of Jacob, and the sweet singer of Israel saith,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Spirit of the Lord spake by me, and his word was in my tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The God of Israel spake to me, the strength of Israel said, Thou shalt bear rule over men, being just, and ruling in the fear of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even as the morning light when the sun riseth, the morning, I say, without clouds, so shall mine house be, and not as the grass of the earth is by the bright rain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For so shall not mine house be with God: for he hath made with me an everlasting covenant, perfect in all points, and sure: therefore all mine health and whole desire is, that he will not make it grow so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the wicked shall be every one as thorns thrust away, because they cannot be taken with hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the man that shall touch them, must be defenced with iron, or with the shaft of a spear: and they shall be burnt with fire in the same place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These be the names of the mighty men whom David hath: He that sat in the seat of wisdom, being chief of the princes, was Adino of Ezni, he slew eight hundred at one time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after him was Eleazar the son of Dodo, the son of Ahohi, one of the three worthies with David, when they defied the Philistines gathered there to battle, when the men of Israel were gone up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He arose and smote the Philistines, until his hand was weary, and his hand clave unto the sword: and the Lord gave great victory the same day, and the people returned after him only to spoil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After him was Shammah the son of Agee the Hararite: for the Philistines assembled at a town, where was a piece of a field full of lentils, and the people fled from the Philistines.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he stood in the midst of the field, and defended it, and slew the Philistines: so the Lord gave great victory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward three of the thirty captains went down, and came to David in the harvest time unto the cave of Adullam, and the host of the Philistines pitched in the valley of Rephaim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David was then in an hold, and the garrison of the Philistines was then in Bethlehem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David longed, and said, Oh, that one would give me to drink of the water of the well of Bethlehem which is by the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the three mighty brake into the host of the Philistines, and drew water out of the well of Bethlehem that was by the gate, and took and brought it to David, who would not drink thereof, but poured it for an offering unto the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And said, O Lord, be it far from me, that I should do this. Is not this the blood of the men that went in jeopardy of their lives? therefore he would not drink it. These things did these three mighty men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abishai the brother of Joab, the son of Zeruiah, was chief among the three, and he lifted up his spear against three hundred, and slew them, and he had the name among the three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he was most excellent of the three, and was their captain, but he attained not unto the first three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Benaiah the son of Jehoiada the son of a valiant man, which had done many acts, and was of Kabzeel, slew two strong men of Moab: he went down also, and slew a lion in the midst of a pit in the time of snow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he slew an Egyptian a man of great stature, and the Egyptian had a spear in his hand: but he went down to him with a staff, and plucked the spear out of the Egyptian’s hand, and slew him with his own spear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These things did Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and had the name among the three worthies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was honorable among thirty, but he attained not to the first three: and David made him of his counsel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Asahel the brother of Joab was one of the thirty: Elhanan the son of Dodo of Bethlehem:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shammoth the Harorite: Elika the Harodite:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Helez the Paltite: Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abiezer the Anathothite: Mebunnai the Hushathite:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zalmon an Ahohite: Maharai the Netophathite:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heleb the son of Baanah a Netophathite: Ittai the son of Ribai of Gibeah of the children of Benjamin:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Benaiah the Pirathonite: Hiddai of the river of Gaash:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abi-Albon the Arbathite: Azmaveth the Barhumite:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eliahba the Shaalbonite: of the sons of Jashen, Jonathan:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shammah the Hararite: Ahiam the son of Sharar the Hararite:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eliphelet the son of Ahasbai, the son of Maachathi: Eliam the son of Ahithophel the Gilonite:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hezrai the Carmelite: Paarai the Arbite:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Igal the son of Nathan of Zobah: Bani the Gadite:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zelek the Ammonite: Naharai the Beerothite, the armor-bearer of Joab the son of Zeruiah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ira the Ithrite: Gareb the Ithrite:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Uriah the Hittite, thirty and seven in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the wrath of the Lord was again kindled against Israel, and he moved David against them, in that he said, Go, number Israel and Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the King said to Joab the captain of the host, which was with him, Go speedily now through all the tribes of Israel, from Dan even to Beersheba, and number ye the people, that I may know the number of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joab said unto the King, The Lord thy God increase the people an hundredfold more than they be, and that the eyes of my lord the King may see it: but why doth my lord the King desire this thing?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Notwithstanding the King’s word prevailed against Joab and against the captains of the host: therefore Joab and the captains of the host went out from the presence of the King to number the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they passed over Jordan, and pitched in Aroer at the right side of the city that is in the midst of the valley of Gad, and toward Jazer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they came to Gilead, and to Tahtim Hodshi, so they came to Dan Jaan, and so about to Sidon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And came to the fortress of Tyre and to all the cities of the Hivites and of the Canaanites, and went toward the South of Judah, even to Beersheba.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when they had gone about all the land, they returned to Jerusalem at the end of nine months and twenty days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joab delivered the number and sum of the people unto the King: and there were in Israel eight hundred thousand strong men that drew swords, and the men of Judah were five hundred thousand men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David’s heart smote him, after that he had numbered the people: and David said unto the Lord, I have sinned exceedingly, in that I have done: therefore now, Lord, I beseech thee, take away the trespass of thy servant: for I have done very foolishly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when David was up in the morning, the word of the Lord came unto the Prophet Gad David’s Seer, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go, and say unto David, Thus saith the Lord, I offer thee three things, choose thee which of them I shall do unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Gad came to David, and showed him, and said unto him, Wilt thou that seven years famine come upon thee in thy land, or wilt thou flee three months before thine enemies, they following thee, or that there be three days pestilence in my land? now advise thee, and see, what answer I shall give to him that sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David said unto Gad, I am in a wonderful strait: let us fall now into the hand of the Lord, (for his mercies are great) and let me not fall into the hand of man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord sent a pestilence in Israel from the morning even unto the time appointed: and there died of the people from Dan even to Beersheba seventy thousand men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Angel stretched out his hand upon Jerusalem to destroy it, the Lord repented of the evil, and said to the Angel, that destroyed the people, It is sufficient, hold now thine hand. And the Angel of the Lord was by the threshing place of Araunah the Jebusite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David spake unto the Lord (when he saw the Angel that smote the people) and said, Behold, I have sinned, yea, I have done wickedly, but these sheep, what have they done? let thine hand, I pray, thee, be against me and against my father’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Gad came the same day to David, and said unto him, Go up, rear an altar unto the Lord in the threshing floor of Araunah the Jebusite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David (according to the saying of Gad) went up, as the Lord had commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Araunah looked, and saw the king and his servants coming toward him, and Araunah went out, and bowed himself before the King on his face to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Araunah said, Wherefore is my lord the king come to his servant? Then David answered, to buy the threshing floor of thee for to build an altar unto the Lord, that the plague may cease from the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Araunah said unto David, Let my lord the King take and offer what seemeth him good in his eyes: behold the oxen for the burnt offering, and chariots, and the instruments of the oxen for wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (All these things did Araunah as a king give unto the king: and Araunah said unto the king, The Lord thy God be favorable unto thee.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king said unto Araunah, Not so, but I will buy it of thee at a price, and will not offer burnt offering unto the Lord my God of that which doth cost me nothing. So David bought the threshing floor, and the oxen for fifty shekels of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David built there an altar unto the Lord, and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings, and the Lord was appeased toward the land, and the plague ceased from Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator
